Student | 19 | New York City
Hey there, my name is Frank Chan and I study computer science in the Cornell University College of Engineering. On campus I am involved in Cornell's first generation student initiative, First in Class, as co-lead of the Communications committee, as well as a member of Cornell Engineering World Health's comptuer science subteam. Outside of school my interests range from coding to paddling to binge watching shows, to, of course, trying new foods. One of my favorite things to do is try new restuarants. See where I've been, what I've done, and what I'm doing. Or go right ahead and leave a message down below.
myprojects
Cornell First in Class Website

Official website for Cornell First in Class, with news, events, and information regarding Cornell's first generation student initiatives.

Technologies used: HTML, CSS, jQuery, MySQL, PHP

LeafDB

A functional local file storage system implemented in OCaml with SQL-like commands to query. Information is stored in csv files organized into different directories.

Technologies used: OCaml

Dash in the Dark

A two player maze race written in HTML5 and vanilla Javascript. Find your way out of the randomly generated maze in the dark and fight to win.

Technologies used: HTML5, Javascript

pyDuctor

Control your music by using hand motions to adjust the volume and pitch of .wav files. Created during Hack BU, my first hackathon.

Technologies used: Python, LeapMotion

debuglog

My personal mission starting 2016 is to track my coding experiences through this debug log, where I write about my projects, my bugs, and often my own foolishness. I hope writing in digital ink will help me remember my past mistakes and how to grow from them. Feel free to follow me during the painful process of learning. Witness my small victories, my biggest blunders, and my greatest triumps. It's going to be great!
